title: Vlad Jr., Springer jolt Jays offense in Game 3 rout
content: The Blue Jays, after losing the first two games of the ALCS at home, tattooed baseballs all over T-Mobile Park on Wednesday, smashing five home runs and four doubles in a 13-4 rout of the Mariners to avoid facing an elimination game Thursday.

content: George Pickens, who is set to become an unrestricted free agent after the season, praised the Cowboys but noted he also wants to "showcase my talents."

content: Around 25 people from the transgender community in Indore claimed to have consumed phenyl together on Wednesday night after which they were admitted to a government hospital, an official said.

content: US President Donald Trump was defending his trade policy when he claimed that he used tariff threats to broker a truce between warring Pakistan and Iran.

title: Defence Ministry Signs Rs 659 Crore Deal For Night Sights For SIG 716 Rifles

content: Leadership in biotechnology will require India to streamline its ecosystem and channel resources into high-impact areas. The government, industry leaders, and academia need to consolidate funding, build integrated infrastructure, and reconcile regulatory standards with international best practices

content: Despite recurrence of rape and gangrape incidents in Odisha over the last 15 months, the CM remained silent, charged Sulata Deo, BJD Rajya Sabha MP

content: Chhindwara Additional Collector Dhirendra Singh said the child had been admitted in Nagpur since September 14 but her condition did not improve

content: According to industry experts, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu are quite ahead of Karnataka in terms of data centre infrastructure

content: Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Limited plans to set up 76 such kiosks across the city, supported by transfer stations and community-level composting initiatives

content: Two NDA allies, Upendra Kushwaha‚Äôs Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and Jitan Ram Manjhi‚Äôs Hindustan Awam Morcha, have publicly expressed their displeasure. JD(U) has also conveyed their objections while refraining from making any public remarks.

content: His family says it would allow the post-mortem only after a case is registered, demands probe into four-page note and video left by him

content: The petition says that though the right to consult a lawyer during an inquiry is statutorily recognised, it is not uniformly enforced by investigating agencies

content: West Bengal CM says slums are being replaced by highrises full of outsiders, driving her voters away from Bhabanipur; Leader of Opposition says BJP leads in five out of eight wards in the constituency

title: Vellore Corporation issues NOC to relay VIT Road near Katpadi station
content: Corporation officials said that the stretch, which is 2.6 km long and 14 metres wide, was taken up to lay underground pipelines and construction of manholes for drainage work more than six months ago.

content: The overall security situation, especially the Afghanistan-Pakistan border conflict, is expected to be part of the discussion

content: KPS are model government-run schools that provide education from pre-primary to II PU under one roof, with both English and Kannada medium options

content: The 96-page book, featuring a sweeping range of photographs, explores the unique socio-religious and ecological landscape of one of the country‚Äôs most important centres of Naga worship

title: Night light data from 2013 and 2023 reveals limited urban growth in Bihar
content: Nighttime illumination is used as a proxy to gauge electricity usage and identify levels of urbanisation; very high illumination rose from 0% in 2013 to 1.6% in 2023, and was seen only in Patna

content: Nature Environment and Wildlife Society‚Äôs mangrove-linked aquaculture project lauded as a model for sustainable livelihoods

title: Veteran singer Rao Balasaraswati passes away
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan remembered her as a first-generation singer and actress who earned a special place in classical and light music

title: Over 11,000 applications received for next Haj season
content: Telangana was allotted a quota of 4,292 seats and 3,453 were selected by means of drawing lots; 4,617 applicants on the waiting list

title: 'Frightened': Rahul slams PM Modi over Trump's Russian oil claim; launches 5-point attack
content: Congress has attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi. They claim he compromised India's dignity. This follows US President Donald Trump's statement. Trump said Modi assured him India would stop buying Russian oil. Congress calls Russia a close ally. They state relationships should not be damaged for personal ties. Modi is called a weak Prime Minister. His actions have unsettled foreign policy.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
content: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: 'Most welcome': Pakistan's Khawaja Asif backs Trump‚Äôs mediation in Taliban conflict
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif has urged former US President Donald Trump to mediate in easing tensions with Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. Asif praised Trump's past peace efforts, calling him a leader who stopped wars and welcomed his potential involvement in current negotiations. The minister also bizarrely accused India of sponsoring the Taliban and waging a proxy war against Pakistan.

title: 'When you decide to give up': Kohli shares vague social media post
content: The Indian cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, arrived in Perth after travel delays for a series against Australia. Virat Kohli posted an inspirational message after the team's arrival, with the upcoming ODI series marking a potential last tour Down Under for him and Rohit Sharma, who have focused solely on ODIs.

title: Inside Bengaluru doctor‚Äôs dark plan: Wife killed with anaesthesia overdose
content: A Bengaluru doctor, Mahendra Reddy, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his wife, Dr. Kritika Reddy, six months ago. Her death was initially attributed to natural causes, but forensic reports revealed toxic substances. Mahendra reportedly confessed to poisoning her, citing marital discord over undisclosed health issues. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Bollywood celebs in court: Why stars fight deepfakes; personality rights explained
content: Bollywood stars are increasingly turning to courts for protection against a surge in deepfakes and AI-driven identity misuse. Akshay Kumar recently sought relief from the Bombay High Court, joining a growing list of celebrities like the Bachchans and Hrithik Roshan who have secured legal safeguards. These legal battles highlight the weaponization of AI, with fake trailers, fabricated endorsements, and even explicit content targeting public figures.

title: Indore transgender dera: Feud between 2 factions turns into mass suicide bid
content: Dozens of transgender individuals attempted mass suicide by consuming floor cleaner in Indore, later escalating to a self-immolation bid outside a hospital. While authorities are investigating the complex motives, including alleged assault and inter-community disputes over leadership and property, the situation remains tense with ongoing protests and attacks on media.

title: IND vs AUS: Kohli, Rohit and Team India arrive in Perth after flight delays for ODIs
content: The Indian cricket squad, led by Shubman Gill, has arrived in Perth after travel delays.  The team, featuring stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, will compete in a three-match ODI series against Australia.  Kohli and Sharma, returning to ODIs after focusing on T20s and Tests, are expected to be key players in the upcoming fixtures.

title: 'Tied me up, took selfies': Greta Thunberg breaks silence on 'torture' in Israel
content: Greta Thunberg alleges mistreatment by Israeli authorities after her detention during the Freedom Flotilla. She claims guards subjected her to physical abuse, threats, and harassment, including being tied up and having selfies taken. Thunberg emphasizes the focus should remain on the Palestinian blockade, not her personal experience.

title: AI confusion: Salesforce CEO admits customers still don‚Äôt get it; stock down by 30%
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff acknowledged that many enterprise customers struggle with AI implementation, as innovation outpaces adoption. Despite a stock slump and investor skepticism, Salesforce is increasing AI investment, with its Agentforce platform now core to its products. While some clients have integrated AI, most face significant architectural challenges.

title: 'Getting out of hand': Ramiz Raja, Aamer Sohail bring up Asia Cup controversy
content: Pakistani teams received handshakes from opponents in hockey and cricket, a welcome sight amidst lingering tensions. Despite a dominant 93-run Test victory over South Africa, commentators used the moment to criticize India's past refusal to reciprocate sportsmanship, highlighting the ongoing impact of the Asia Cup controversy.

title: Biden moment? Trump fumbles on India, Iran; reiterates tariff claim ‚Äî Watch
content: US President Donald Trump mistakenly referred to India as Iran twice while discussing a ceasefire negotiation between Pakistan and Iran. Trump claimed he threatened both nations with 200% tariffs to prevent a nuclear war. However, India's Prime Minister Modi refuted these claims, stating no global leader urged India to halt its response to a 'big attack' from Pakistan.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take a break; underlines this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: Brian Branch‚Äôs suspension upheld as Lions face key NFC clash without him
content: Detroit Lions player Brian Branch faces a one-game suspension. The NFL upheld the decision after an on-field incident. Branch's actions were deemed aggressive and a violation of league rules. He will miss an important game. Coach Dan Campbell called the act inexcusable. Branch apologized, calling his behavior childish. The league cited risk of injury and poor reflection on the NFL.

title: IND vs AUS: Shocking! Shastri breaks silence on Rohit and Kohli‚Äôs retirement
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have "enough cricket in them" for future ODIs, including the 2027 World Cup, but emphasizes individual hunger and fitness. He suggests players will decide their own ODI futures, similar to their Test retirements, as the BCCI dismisses speculation about the Australia series being their last.

title: Priya tells HC wrong spellings, addresses can‚Äôt void Sunjay Kapur's will
content: During a recent session at the Delhi High Court, Priya, the wife of Sunjay Kapur, firmly rebutted allegations from Karisma Kapoor's children regarding the authenticity of his will. Her attorney highlighted that minor discrepancies, such as typos or incorrect addresses, do not render a will null and void, especially when the signatures in question are unimpeachable.

title: Erika Kirk reveals late husband Charlie‚Äôs 'presidential ambitions'
content: Charlie Kirk's widow revealed he might have sought the presidency, driven by conviction, not ambition. President Trump honored the late MAGA commentator with a Rose Garden ceremony on his birthday, calling him a "martyr" for conservative values. Trump linked Kirk's death to political violence, contrasting it with the perceived "devil's ideology" of the left.

title: ‚ÄòAs soon as I say‚Äô: Trump says Israel could return to Gaza
content: US President Donald Trump declared that Israeli forces could re-enter Gaza on his command if Hamas violates the ceasefire. He stated that Israel would swiftly address Hamas's non-compliance with hostage releases. Trump emphasized Hamas must disarm, warning of forceful action if they refuse, while also mentioning international backing for his peace plan.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,400; BSE Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 25,400, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: 'He is a great man': Trump says PM Modi assured him India won't buy Russian oil; hits out at Putin
content: US President Donald Trump announced that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured him India will cease Russian oil purchases. Trump expressed satisfaction with this commitment, viewing it as a significant step towards de-escalating the Ukraine conflict. He highlighted his strong relationship with Modi and reiterated his desire for the war to end swiftly.

title: UK strikes at Putin's oil war chest: 90 new sanctions hit Rosneft, Lukoil, India‚Äôs Nayara
content: The UK has imposed 90 new sanctions on Russia's oil sector and Indian firm Nayara Energy Limited to disrupt Moscow's war funding. The measures target oil terminals, tankers, and major Russian energy companies like Rosneft and Lukoil, aiming to reduce Russian oil on the market and cut off revenue streams.

title: US shutdown: Judge blocks Trump from firing federal workers; 'can't be tolerated'
content: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from firing federal workers during the ongoing government shutdown, citing a lack of proper consideration and a "human cost." The decision followed a legal challenge by labor unions arguing the layoff notices were an illegal attempt to pressure Congress.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President, Aakash K Hindocha, has identified Bikaji, Voltas, and Torrent Power as top stock recommendations. Hindocha's analysis suggests a short-term upside for Nifty towards 25450 and Bank Nifty targeting 57250.

title: Tamil Nadu northeast monsoon: Heavy rain lashes Chennai; IMD issues orange alerts
content: The northeast monsoon is expected to arrive in Tamil Nadu, bringing heavy rainfall to Chennai and 21 other districts, with a yellow alert issued. Southern districts may experience very heavy rain, while coastal areas are predicted to receive moderate showers for the next five days. This monsoon is vital, contributing significantly to the state's and city's annual rainfall.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He‚Äôs serious about 2027'- RCB teammate confirms Virat Kohli‚Äôs comeback for WC
content: Dinesh Karthik revealed that Virat Kohli is actively training for the 2027 World Cup, dedicating time to practice during his recent London break. The star batsman, who has a remarkable ODI record, is reportedly serious about his ambition to participate in the next global tournament.

title: Travis Kelce reveals what happened after scary head fall vs. Lions
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce allayed fears of a serious head or neck injury after a hard landing during Sunday's game. He revealed on his podcast that the impact was a severe "Charlie Horse" to his thigh, not his head. Kelce continued playing, showcasing remarkable toughness and finishing the game strong, much to the relief of fans.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage for flaunting luxury after controversial remarks
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, is facing backlash from fans after a recent Instagram post featuring her playing golf with friends. Critics have accused her of not appreciating her husband and her life, stemming from previous comments on a podcast where she revealed she hadn't initially wanted marriage or children.

title: -Serena Williams vs Maria Sharapova net worth 2025: Who is richer?
content: Tennis titans Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova, despite different paths to success, remain influential figures. Williams, with a net worth of $350 million, continues investing and supporting women's sports. Sharapova, valued at $180 million, thrives with her candy business and real estate ventures. A touching Hall of Fame moment highlighted their enduring respect and friendship.

title: Record ops: ‚ÄòMost affected‚Äô left-wing-hit districts down to 3 from 7
content: India is on the cusp of eradicating Naxalism by March 2026, with affected districts drastically reduced. Home Minister Amit Shah highlighted successful counter-insurgency operations and development initiatives. Andhra and Telangana are now Naxal-free, marking a significant victory in the fight against left-wing extremism.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs gift to Teyana Taylor sparks backlash over shade at Kayla Nicole
content: Taylor Swift's gift to Teyana Taylor for her new album has sparked online speculation. Fans believe the gesture is a subtle jab at Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole, who previously spoke negatively about Teyana's ex-husband, Iman Shumpert. This has reignited a past feud, with Swift's act drawing attention to celebrity entanglements.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers preseason injury report: Who‚Äôs playing and who‚Äôs out
content: Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers clashed in a Las Vegas preseason game, with Dallas prioritizing chemistry and integrating Anthony Davis. The Lakers, however, focused on rest and player development due to injuries and load management. This strategic divergence offered a preview of each team's approach to the upcoming NBA season.

title: Bihar polls: Congress fields over 15 candidates; no Mahagathbandhan seat-sharing deal yet
content: With nominations for the Bihar Assembly elections nearing, the Congress released its first list of over 10 candidates amidst unresolved seat-sharing talks with Mahagathbandhan partners. The party faces internal discontent over alleged irregularities in ticket distribution. Meanwhile, the NDA alliance has also navigated friction over seat allocations.

title: Aryna Sabalenka‚Äôs emotional gesture for Rafael Nadal‚Äôs museum wins hearts
content: Aryna Sabalenka celebrated her 2025 US Open victory by gifting her championship outfit to Rafael Nadal's museum in Mallorca. The signed Nike attire, worn during her second consecutive US Open win, is now a prized exhibit. Sabalenka's gesture highlights her deep admiration for Nadal's work ethic and enduring legacy in tennis.

title: Malcolm Brogdon retirement: NBA star‚Äôs heartfelt message marks end of journey
content: Veteran point guard Malcolm Brogdon has abruptly retired from the NBA after nine seasons, informing the New York Knicks of his decision. Brogdon, a former Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, cited a desire to end his career on his own terms. His unexpected departure leaves the Knicks with a void at the point guard position.

title: Chaos! Fan climbs enclosure, breaks into Pakistan dressing room to meet Babar Azam - WATCH
content: A young fan breached security at Gaddafi Stadium during a cricket match. The fan sought to meet star batsman Babar Azam. This occurred on Azam's birthday. Security personnel intervened and removed the fan. The Pakistan Cricket Board has not yet commented on the incident. Babar Azam remains a popular figure among fans.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys star on track for Week 7 vs Commanders
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a return from a high-ankle sprain, potentially for Week 7 against the Commanders.  Lamb has shown significant progress, participating in team walkthroughs and expected to practice. His comeback would significantly bolster the Cowboys' offense, especially in the passing game and red zone, offering a crucial boost for their playoff hopes.
